result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell James Tompkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).
  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (51 pages) commencing DECEMBER 12, 2014, received and filed.  jm
Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
Counts one and six.
Amended per restitution ordered.

Attorney Rick Steinberg apperared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins appeared in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have reached an agreement.
Upon stipulation of the parties, Court ordered restitutuion as follows:

* Defendant is to PAY restitution in the amount of $3,024.00 payable to the victim's mother, Maria M.  The Court ordered that restution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  THIS IS TO BE PAID FIRST.

* Defendant is to PAY restitutuion in the amount of $961,000.00 payable to Badger Care.  The Court ordered that restution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Attorney Rick Steinberg apperared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Restitution Hearing today; Atty. Steinberg in another court.
Case adjourned to 03-10-2015 at 11:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Restitution Hearing.

Associated with Charge #6
Associated with Charge #1/corrected

Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by one victim's mother, Maria M.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 6, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS.
Credit for 232 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 6:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 52 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 1, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 34 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 6):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* Take any and all medications as prescribed.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* As to Count 6, Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 2 years.
* As to Count 6, defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* As to Count 6, restitution will be determined at the upcoming Restitution Hearing.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Case adjourned to 02-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Note:  Amended Information ADDS Count 6:  Injury by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle Causing Great Bodily Harm [a Class F FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.25(1)(a), 939.50(3)(f).  
**Note:  Amended Information ADDS Count 7:  Injury by Intoxicated Use of a Vehicle Causing Great Bodily Harm - Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance [a Class F FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.25(1)(am), 939.50(3)(f).

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 6:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #s 2, 3, 4, 5, and 7 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:James Jarvis-MCSD Deputy.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding Waukesha County case #14CF75 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by SCRAM, drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Mitchell James Tompkins in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
